title: FCC Repeals Net Neutrality Regulations Under Industry Pressure
summary: The FCC voted along party lines to repeal Obama-era net neutrality regulations, eliminating rules that prevented internet service providers from blocking, slowing, or prioritizing web traffic. The decision shifts internet regulation from the FCC to the Federal Trade Commission, potentially allowing ISPs to control internet access and speed based on financial agreements.

sources.title: FCC Repeals Net Neutrality Rules For Internet Providers
FCC Repeals Net Neutrality Rules Designed to Provide Equal Access to Internet
